thread.title: Panthers prevail: Daviess County gets rolling to drop Ohio County, 43-7
thread.title_full: Panthers prevail: Daviess County gets rolling to drop Ohio County, 43-7

author: MARK MATHIS Messenger-Inquirer
title: Panthers prevail: Daviess County gets rolling to drop Ohio County, 43-7
text:
Close Greg Eans 
Photo by Greg Eans, Messenger-Inquirer/geans@messenger-inquirer.com Daviess County High School's Zack McAteer is taken down by Ohio County HIgh School's Inglis Colbren in first quarter action Friday at Frank Barnes Memorial Stadium in Hartford. featured Panthers prevail: Daviess County gets rolling to drop Ohio County, 43-7 BY MARK MATHIS Messenger-Inquirer 0 Greg Eans 
Photo by Greg Eans, Messenger-Inquirer/geans@messenger-inquirer.com Daviess County High School's Zack McAteer is taken down by Ohio County HIgh School's Inglis Colbren in first quarter action Friday at Frank Barnes Memorial Stadium in Hartford. 
HARTFORD â€” There was uncertainty in Matt Brannon's mind about how his Daviess County football team would look at Ohio County on Friday night. 
The DC head coach didn't need to worry. 
The Panthers scored touchdowns the first four times they had the ball, intercepted Ohio County quarterback Heath Simmons four times, including a pick six, and rolled to a 43-7 win at Frank Barnes Memorial Stadium. 
"I was nervous that we would underestimate this team," Brannon said. "They are a hard-nosed football team, they are well coached, they are efficient on offense. I know the score was lopsided last year, but I know coach (Jody) Ashby is doing good things here, their record shows it. For us to come out the way we did, I was excited." 
Chase LeCroy ran 11 times for 185 yards, with a 3-yard touchdown run and a beautiful 17-yard touchdown catch from Adam Bouchard in the first half. 
Bouchard hit Jordan Powell with a 64-yard touchdown pass for DC's second score. Powell set up his own score by getting the first interception of the night for DC. 
Bouchard also made an 18-yard touchdown throw to John Stratton, and that score was set up by the first of two Chandler Crite interceptions. Bouchard finished 9-of-16 passing for 195 yards. 
Braxton Hurley had a very quick pick six, getting an interception in the end zone after Ohio County had made a goal line stand. 
"We had four picks, the defense stepped up," Brannon said. "For us to get pressure on the quarterback, we pressued him all night, that was a key for us." 
Zack McAteer added a 14-yard touchdown run in the third quarter to help the Panthers climb to 6-3, 2-2 in Class 6-A, Region 1, District 2. 
The Panthers ran for 292 yards as they went for 487 yards in total offense. 
"We got back to the balance we were looking for," Brannon said. "That's one thing we had struggled with. John, teams have figured him out and are double covering him, that opens up other avenues for us. LeCroy came out and was outstanding, the offensive line, good again, Bouchard is making nice throws, doing what he has to do." 
Simmons scored the lone touchdown on a 1-yard sneak for Ohio County (5-4, 1-3). Simmons was 23-for-38 for 280 yards. Noah Miller made eight catches for 137 yards. 
DAVIESS COUNTY 21-14-8-0_43 
DC-LeCroy 3 run (kick failed). 
DC-Powell 64 pass from Bouchard (Carwile pass from Bouchard). 
DC-Stratton 18 pass from Bouchard (Monanteras kick). 
DC-LeCroy 17 pass from Bouchard (Monanteras kick). 
O-Simmons 1 run (Addington kick). 
DC-Hurley interception in end zone (Monanteras kick). 
DC-McAteer 14 run (Crite pass from McEwen). Tags
